column4: New install of 12.04, everything works great EXCEPT I can't click in the top-right corner of any maximized app... clicks seem to go straight through to the desktop.

the little Close icon is there, but only about the left-most 3 pixels actually respond to a click.. everything else goes down to the desktop (if I right-click on the Close button then the desktop's right-click menu pops up)
Anyone have any experience with that issue?
Not something I have ever heard of or experienced.  Did you check the forums out?
making a new account to post on ubuntuforums.org with (since my old account doesn't seem to work anymore)
Go through this testcase and see if it applies please https://bugs.launchpad.net/unity/+bug/880449
193985 seems different than my issue (and is also unresolved hehe) but will check out 880449
880449 is related to the same thing as 193985... thanks for tryin tho :D
my click-through problem is consistent, with every single window I maximize, regardless of whether anything has been minimized or not
also it's only a small square in the top-right corner that covers most of the close button
the menu bar (including the close button) work fine, but only the left-most part of the close button is clickable (when not maxed the whole close button works)
it's like there's a little 10x10px box floating in the top-right corner that's sending all clicks straight through to the desktop

Yeah - I understand your description. Just don't know how to search for it anywhere.  You are best to open up a forum post and maybe even file a bug if you can't find a resolution. Make sure to include your hardware specifics.
yeah that's about the same conclusion I've reached... was hoping it was common enough that an IRC person might recognize it, despite it being a hard thing to google for
Certainly. Sorry I couldn't do more.
